availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farmer. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Son of Robert Rodes and Eliza Delaney Rodes. Married to Pauline Clay Rodes in Madison County, Kentucky, on November 3, 1819. Father of Eliza Rodes Stone, Martha Rodes Breck, Isabella "Belle" Rodes McDowell, and Pauline C. Rodes Field. Resident in Madison County in 1830. Owned forty-one enslaved persons in Madison County in 1830. Engaged in agriculture, manufacture, and trades in Madison County in 1840. Owned thirty-two enslaved persons in Madison County in 1840. Farmer in Madison County in 1850. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. Farmer in Madison County in 1860. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860.
